Class Sorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sorter
  • public class Sorter
extends Object
    Sorter implements a sorting algorithm that can sort integer data in an array which is either provided when the class is instantiated or using the setter. The sort() method can then be called on the instance to sort the data. This class provides sorting by both static and object methods.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int[] data
      The data that is/is to be sorted

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Sorter()
      Empty constructor if we need a sorter but don't yet have the array to be sorted
      Sorter​(int[] a)
      Constructor that is made with the array to be sorted

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public void sort()
        Sorts the data currently in the instance by using a comb sort

      • nextGap

        private int nextGap​(int g)
        A utility method used for calculating the gap size in the comb sort
        Parameters:
        g - The value of the old gap, used to calculate the size of the new gap
        Returns:
        The integer value of the size of the new gap, the size of the gap will always be 1 or greater

      • swap

        private void swap​(int[] a,
                  int i,
                  int j)
        Utility method for swapping elements
        Parameters:
        a - The array in which the swap will happen in
        i - The index of the first element to be swaped
        j - The index of the second element to be swaped

      • timedSort

        public void timedSort()
        Sorts the array with comb sort and times how long (in ms) it takes. Prints time to console

      • setData

        public void setData​(int[] a)
        Setter method to allow for new data to be sorted
        Parameters:
        a - The array that the object's data array is being set to
